info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:33PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher, south central Teton and western Cascade Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Augusta to 9 miles northeast of East Helena. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Helena, Cascade, Fairfield, Augusta, Fort Shaw, Wolf Creek, Fort Logan On The Smith River, York, Nilan Reservoir, Bean Lake, Sun River, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park, Craig, Black Sandy State Park, Simms and Fort Logan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 192 and 268. Highway 200 between mile markers 92 and 139. Highway 12 between mile markers 43 and 47. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 57. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 36, and near mile marker 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to minor localized flooding and debris flow in steep terrain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
